title: Making Pyramids
description: Please enjoy this mix of music to make pyramids to. While eclectic, your record Selectrix, DJ Kittybot, leans towards minimal electronics, ambient, noise, and noisy rock.

title: Chronophage
description:
Music Of Our Time



https://www.mixcloud.com/Swintronix/

https://www.facebook.com/staticatomizer/

https://ello.co/swintronix

http://www.freeformportland.org/show/static-atomizer-w-dj-swintronix/

title: The International Painted Bus Brigade
description: A journey of ethnomusicology including field and archival recordings, ritual music, international counterculture, interviews and live guests making traditional music from around the globe.

title: Tchotchkes
description: Lucifer Rosa provides a conglomeration of miscellaneous doo-dads and knick knacks every Thursday from noon to 2.

title: Live from POP! Tavern
description: Live DJs broadcasting from POP Tavern! Someone new every time.

title: Night Drive Thru Babylon
description: Mystery vibrations from the party dimension

title: Eclectic Static
description: Eclectic Static brings the obscure, the known, the rockers, the jammers, the chill, and the feels to all listeners.

title: Late Night Hype
description: A mix of things to get you hyped for your late night adventures. A musical journey crossing all genres.

title: Nautilus
description: Deep sea divers. Mostly new. Sometimes weird.

title: All Systems Go!
description: My specialties are Garage, Punk, Post Punk, Mod Revival and Glam. Mostly rare 45s and obscure artists.

title: Big Green Jones Show
description:
"80's & 90's Alternative Rock / New Wave / Grunge / Shoegaze / Goth

All Vinyl. All Love. 
Hosted by
DJ Colin Jones (SNAP 90's, XRAY.fm, Ground Kontrol, Freeform Portland)

I love cloudy day alternative classics and I am obsessed with records.
For 10+ years I worked at record stores in Denver and Portland and the Big Green Jones Show is where I share the love

title: The After Party
description: They say that variety is the spice of life and that is exactly what makes our show so great. The After Party is a variety show consisting of around 50% Talk and 50% Music and every week we have a different theme. One week we may play 80's music... the next it could be Ska... or even requested cover songs. We always keep the topics lighthearted so you can sit back relax and have some fun.

title: Flowmatics
description: Hip-hop Sets, Nu Disco//Electronic Sets & Heavier EDM.

title: Astral Boogie
description: Everything from folky to freaky to funky, and back again, it's the perfect mix to groove through your afternoon, with songs that you already love mixed with a heap of brand new tracks that are soon to become your new favorites.

title: Wake Up And Chill
description: Diverse mixshow featuring chilled out, electronic and sample-based music, instrumentals, and anything else with a focus on intriguing and unique sounding instrumental, electronic, or vocal production. For waking up and starting your day on a chiller wave.

title: The Great Pain of Space
description: A tapestry of folk and folk-rock, industrial and noise, ambient and experimental sounds, post-punk and synth-wave, and the mysteries that connect them.

title: Get On My Wavelength
description: Showcasing underground music from cities in the US and Internationally. All music will come from a donation or cost free site such as Bandcamp, Soundcloud, etc.

title: The Attic
description: Music. Wide genre of things, Outlaw Country, Soul, Post Punk, Sludge.

title: Bachelard’s Panty Drawer
description: 1/3 conversation and 2/3 music, Bachelard’s Panty Drawer explores a particular theme for each show (work, ambition, dreams, birth, money, pre-history, black holes, romance, happiness, domestication, etc.) that drives both the conversation and playlist. Conversations are between Mammal in Crime (Felicity Fenton) and various artists/writers/musicians/thinkers. The music is eclectic and taps into multiple genres.

title: Teenage Depression
description: Teenage Depression with Suzanne Bummers focuses on 77-81 punk, post punk, 60s fuzzy garage and anything that breaks yours heart. Brief discussions on topics such as the Portland music scene and current events sporadically pop up.

title: Where The Traffic Goes!
description: Where the Traffic Goes is a radio program that plays the best in classic UK and US indiepop, punk rock, '60s heartbreak, DIY noise, and '80s underground.

title: WHOA THIS IS HEAVY
description: WHOA THIS IS HEAVY with DJ zen_hound focuses on the heavy music scenes, labels and venues of the Pacific Northwest. From Corvallis to Vancouver B.C., underground metal, punk and noise are Cascadian treasures waiting to be unearthed.

title: audio Circumambulation
description: 78s to space bloops, lots of shaking in between:::awe-dee-ooh yarns for horologists

title: Wave of Mutilation
description:
Welcome to the wave of mutilation. The purpose of this show is to support underground artists and showcase the music and recordings of the people! 
I have sent out a message across the world, scouring the internet for independent artists and labels. There are a lot of talented musicians out there, and i am here to display them for you, by doing so I hope to help these artists spread the word of their sounds. 
If you have any music to submit to the show please send it to 

waveofmutilationPDX@Gmail. Com 

I will accept recordings of any genre, new bands with plans to tour the northwest, or old defunct bands with forgotten records. Send me your best recordings! 

If you're coming through Portland I want to plug your dive bar or basement show. I want to supply an outlet for your old forgotten recordings or favorite unheard artists. 

Seriously, if you have a cassette or hard drive full of weird sounds that you've compiled into something you are super proud of, I want to hear it! 

If you have non digital music please send a request for the address to send hard copies of your music. 

Thank you and please spread the word!!

title: The Osmosis
description: Miniature musings with Faye-James Lamtrick and special guests, peppered between long listens on the rolling tide of tunes. An eclectic mix of music to haunt your soul or shake your shaker to.

title: Do the 45
description: Tune in for 2 hours of whacked out 45s from the 50s and 60s! Expect a smorgasbord of tunes from soul, r&b, garage, rockabilly, doo wop and blues!

title: SILVERFISH MUSIC
description: SILVERFISH MUSIC IS A PROGRAM THAT PROMOTES UNDERGROUND MUSIC NOT ON BILLBOARDS CHARTS 40. WE FOCUS ON DOMESTIC AND INTERNATIONAL ELECTRONIC MUSIC GENRES SUCH AS AFROTECH, ACID JAZZ, NEO-SOUL AND DEEP HOUSE.

title: Club Mate
description:
Mudclub, Berghain, Batcave, Clit Club, The Spectrum, and now Club Mate. Sexy music for the glittering, revolutionary, downtown crowd. Current and classic cuts across genre.

MUSIC IS OUR WEAPON. MUSIC IS THEE COMMON DENOMINATOR. OUR RELIGION IS BEAUTY. WE WIELD ONLY THE SWORD OF FLAWLESSNESS. OUR ANGER IS OUTWEIGHED ONLY BY OUR DESIRE FOR GORGEOUSNESS. WE'VE COME TO DESTROY THE MAN, RECLAIM THE FEMININE IDENTITY, AND ANCHOR THE WHITE LIGHT FOR ALL BEINGS. WE CONSCIOUSLY ERADICATE THE FEAR WE'VE BEEN PROGRAMMED TO HAVE IN OUR HEARTS, AND THAT'S WHY WE'RE SO MUTHAFUCKIN BAD.

This is our soundtrack.

Sludge. Vogue. House. Deathrock. Doom. Digital Hardcore. Italo Disco. Industrial. New Age. New Romantic. Punk. Avant Garde. Techno. Rave. Ambient. Yé-yé Grrrl. Hip Hop. Trip Hop. Dub. Voodoo. Acid. Ecstasy. Animals. High Heels. Long Nails. Shaved Headed Girls and Longhaired Boys. Whatever.

title: Flavors Radio
description: Tune into Flavors Radio every Friday from 8-10am. With your host DJ Kay Tu spinning nothing but Hip Hop and RnB from back in the day.

title: MySelf presents
description:
From Bob James to teen suicide, XXXTENTATION to Donald Byrd,
MySelf presents: anything different.

title: Sick, Sad World
description: Lo-fi bedroom pop, weirdo indie rock, and outsider music. Music to stare at your ceiling to.  Music to braid your hair to. This show will make you believe in love again.

title: Low Tide Guide
description: I would like to jest play some records thru my sp-404 instrument and dj thru a predetermined set of songs and throwing some personal mix elements during and between some songs.

title: The VoidCast
description:
The VoidCast features thematic episodes centering around genre, process, context, and form, as well as short conversations with creatives. These interviews include discussions regarding the creative process, how one finds and maintains inspiration, what creatives do when they encounter a slump, and what drives their process forward.

Any dialogue is unified around sounds by or inspiring to the creatives who are sharing their stories, as well as music that compliments common aspects of the conversation. Each program is a journey without borders or constraints; in the Void, anything can--and must--occur.

title: Rude Dog Radio
description: A potpourri of sound: electronic, lo-fi, folk, hip hop, indie, punk rock

title: Bizarre Times
description: Do you feel as passionate about Alexander O'Neal as you do about John Foxx? What do Human League and Janet Jackson have in common? Are you into that dank Italo? Minimal Wave? Wax Trax? This show is about those feels and more.

title: Hermetically Sealed
description: A weekly exploration of the cosmos through the vessel of music and half-baked musings. Hermetically Sealed presents an invocation to the universe in the form of a slopped together playlist. All songs chosen are inspired by current astrological transits.

title: Under the Rug
description: A show dedicated to the underappreciated albums of years past, each week Under The Rug goes below the surface of rock history to examine should-be rock 'n' roll classics. Listeners will follow along with DJ Bare Bones and DJ Hunter as they shine a light on albums from the '60's through 80's that have fallen through the cracks of time and deserve greater examination through context of the band, the styles of the times, and the benefits of hindsight.

title: Under the Radar/On the Rise
description: Highlighting new music from a variety of indie formats; from rock and folk, to soul, R&B or rap, as well as the occasional house track and remix "Under the Radar /On the Rise" aims to shine a light on a portion of music making a stir on the interwebs where mainstream radio stays mum.

title: Bummer Summer
description: Playing primarily physical media. Records and tapes.  Music is cheaper than therapy. Psych, Surf, Modern and old.  Music from across the globe will be played, as well as local favorites being highlighted.  All shapes and sizes of music will be included.  This hour will make the bummer summer slightly more bearable.  Focus is primarily on the jamz, with guest musicians coming in for interviews, discussions, playlists.

title: Static + Distance
description: Joshua Justice pulls from a cosmically bestowed record collection to bring you Static + Distance. Featuring hot tracks and savory licks from all eras, genres and dimensions with zero regard to the constructs of time, space or laws of physics. Expect heartbreakers, burners, shakers, bummers and more. Always solid jams.

title: She’s Lost Control
description: "She's Lost Control" invades the dark cracks and crevices of post-punk from past to present, from local waves to overseas. We will seep ourselves into goth-laden synths, stomp a lead foot on the pedal board of experimental noise (with the occasional horn of avant-garde jazz), and unveil the raving floors of dance metal.

title: The Funk Pharmacy
description: The Funk Pharmacy gives listeners the best soul and funk music that they have ever heard, along with all of the cuts that they have never heard. Dr. Soul is cocked, locked, and ready to rock to fill your prescription when he jumps on the 1's and 2's. Jammin', rammin', and always slamming the hits through your speakers, he delivers what you need tight and right every time. Come get down to the greatest jams on the only station you need on your FM dial, 90.3 KFFP. Dig it, P-Town!

title: Slpyfck
description: Electronicaust. March to the beat of a programmed drum.

title: Instead of White Men
description: We know that electronic music is largely dominated by white dudes; but let's explore the fantastic sounds made by women and people of color. Even though diversity is challenging to find among the labels, 'Instead of White Men' will highlight a wide-breadth of electronic music from ambient and experimental to world infusion to disco, house, and techno. Sounds will be heard, commentary will ensue, maybe even a track from a token white dude--who knows?

title: Kitty McKlaine’s Dance Party
description: A mix of current through 80s new wave, synth pop, electro and dance music.

title: Ears In The Cornfield
description: Ears in the Cornfield is a bouquet of music. Hand picked. Hand delivered.

title: Portland Listening Group
description: Dub is the deep exploration and exploitation of the easiest available musical tools. Dive In. Tune Out. Get In Deep. Music from both sides of the field. From dub to electro and all else deep.

title: Turns up to 11
description: Music that feeds the mind body and soul.

title: Distant Dreams
description: A bi-weekly program focusing on capturing an event split of mood and nostalgia through sounds, musical and otherwise, which is inherently linked to the underground and/or counter-cultural movements of the last 50 years.

title: Wall of Sound
description: Punk, Power Pop/BubbleGum & Garage Rock

title: Gradual Process
description: Music that searches for connections between seemingly disparate genres -expect to hear lots of modern classical, other instrumental musics, post-punk, power pop, and jazz.

title: driving fast on empty streets
description: Moody, murky, and a little dark.

title: Therapy
description: Everyone's a little bit of a bummer deep down. At Therapy, being a bummer is encouraged, with a full hour (?) of downtrodden tunes fit to wallow to.

title: lighter than air
description: this is a music show reflecting jangle, edgy, dream & 'gazes, plus all predecessors. will there be synth. yes on occasion there will be synth! will there be something random? yes there will be! let's not leave out anything in the venn diagram ~~~

title: Cool Tapes
description: Sonic density for the up-at-4AM set

title: Jesuit Bit My Hot Dog
description: Novelty records are often parodies or humor songs which use unusual lyrics, subjects, sounds, or instrumentation, and may not even be musical. Danny Norton's first vinyl LP purchase was Weird Al Yankovic's 1984 album "In 3D." He pivoted to accumulate exotica records like Martin Denny and Esquivel's when they were dramatically undervalued in discount record bins. Danny pursued his interests in performing stand-up comedy and studying documentary filmmaking to Portland in May, 2000. He cofounded theater and short film collective Extra Medium Sketch Comedy and mobile music video museum Eye Candy VJs, which is still featured several nights weekly in bars and restaurants. He continues to hoard unconventional recordings to enjoy at home, but is excited to share his collection with friends and strangers over Freeform Portland's airwaves. Jesuit Bit My Hotdog is a comical allusion to Industrial rock band Ministry's 1992 single "Jesus Built My Hotrod."

title: Getting Weird After Hours
description: It's late and things are getting weird on Freeform Portland. Princess Dude and Scarlett take you wherever the mind goes when it's past your bedtime and all the bars are closed.

title: Based Goth Radio
description: Chopped & Screwed New Wave

title: Turn the Beat Around
description: An eclectic show that focuses on thematic connections between disparate genres, current non-mainstream music, and odd corners of the pop universe.

title: The Amos Ananda Show
description: irresponsible radio bouncy-bouncy

title: Get On My Wavelength / Hermetically Sealed (Alternating)
description:
Get On My Wavelength: Music varying in genres tying international music with local music! Using mainly cassettes, vinyl and cds.

Hermetically Sealed: A two hour astrological invocation to your cosmic muses in the form of a  biweekly broadcast. Join the last Mercurian, Madame Madman, as he decodes our zodiacal fate through the astro-synthesis  of music and sound.

title: Dr. Fuzz’s Heavy Psychedelic Experience
description: A clinic on psychedelic rock, stoner metal, krautrock and related and semi-related genres with an international bent. All that and more intercut with the ramblings of an antisocial music nerd and audio clips that make you think/laugh. 20+ minute long musical explorations being more common than your standard 2-3 minute pop song, with a hefty dose of unsigned and self promoted bands. Also features special episodes that diverge greatly from the norm.

title: Spider in the Ear
description:
C’mon, you can guess what it’s like.

Dark ambient, sort of creepy, sometimes? Sure, of course. Post-rock, drone, grindcore, metal… sometimes. Sometimes there’s a little old-time song and dance number, and it can go… oh, anywhere from there. Spooky Southern gothic. “Electronica.” J-Pop and klezmer and hot club jazz. Cut-ups and mash-ups. Freak folk, psych rock. Field recordings… Hauntology. Lichenthropy.

Sometimes it’s like getting a lap dance at the butoh performance. Bees in your heart, fleas up your spine.

Rarely painful, more like an intermittent but persistent, muted drumming you can’t quite place. Something “else,” lodged up in there, and you don’t know if it’s digging its way out or digging in.

Sometimes it skips, like a broken thing, like a heartbeat.

You know what it’s like, don’t you?

title: Nightlight
description: A multifarious collection of music to keep you company in the dark. New and old, major and minor, hot and cold, here and there.

title: Guitar and Other Machines
description: Some noise, some ambient, some drone, some familiar friends. Lotsa stuff that may only be interesting because it's actually now being played on the FM dial/has just been played next to something else/has been pulled out of context/is played at a different speed (with and without intention).

title: Bonus Beats
description:
House, Techno, Electro, Freestyle and Disco in the mix every Friday night from 8-10pm, with your host DJ Christopher LaRose and guest mixes from DJs near and far.

Twitter (for On-Air Shout Outs + Communications): @bonusbeats
Bonus Beats Episode Archive: mixcloud.com/Bonus-Beats
DJ LaRose on Soundcloud: soundcloud.com/christopherlarose

title: Futures and Pasts
description: '70s/'80s post-punk obscurities, DIY pop eccentrics, forgotten women of the underground, demos from the newest noisemaking upstarts & more.

title: Abattoir
description: Abattoir: Artisanal Butt-Rock.

title: Cities in Dust
description: Cities in Dust is an exploration of music for the end times, with all manner of extreme and otherwise infrequently explored sounds. Listeners can expect everything from raw black metal demos to musique concrete, with moments of neofolk, minimal synth, krautrock, and post-punk along the way. The aim is to examine music that challenges the boundaries in which it was created, whether sonic or societal.

title: Club Nitty Gritty
description:
Early Soul, R&B, Houserockin' Blues, Proto-Funk and more -> -> -> -> CLUB NITTY GRITTY is named for the unpolished, radical punk 'n' blues Portland that is rapidly disappearing. This radio show will celebrate Portland's true raggedy and eccentric Pacific Northwest spirit via music with FILTHY sax, JAGGED edges, and low down DIRTY grooves.

djactionslacks.com
www.facebook.com/clubnittygritty/
www.facebook.com/DJActionSlacks/
www.instagram.com/djactionslacks/

title: Looking for a Home
description: songs to break up to and songs to make up to: playing songs I love with a French flair and some local musicians who should be heard!

title: Full Radical Life Radio
description:
Music. Talk. Disabilities.

Full Life is an art, recreation, and vocational program for adults living with developmental disabilities based in Portland, OR. Every Tuesday and Wednesday we perform an improvised talk show together. We make up songs, take questions from our listeners, and talk about topics both serious and hilarious.

http://feeds.feedburner.com/fullliferadio
http://www.full-lifepdx.com
http://www.myspace.com/flashtvpdx

title: Makeout Sesh
description: Allow me to be your soundtrack as your Friday night turns into Saturday. Enjoy some real vibey grooves — an eclectic mix of new & old-school psychedelic, soul, trip-hop, indie, electronica and beyond — Get ready to find yourself in a makeout sesh.

title: Well Worn and New Territory
description: Eclectic variety with old soul tendencies

title: From Me To You
description: An examination of the way our present moment is both a result of our history and the first sentence of our future, featuring recorded music from Portland and around the world, spanning 80 years.

title: Makeup & Booze
description: Playing early rock&roll, punk, girl-groups, glam, bubble gum and power pop to keep your life slightly tipsy in the best way possible. On a mission to get you sweet and sick.

title: ADHD / Eclectronic Dawn (Alternating)
description:
Attn: Deficient Planet Disorder with DJ Clair + guest host.  Garage, post-punk, punk, metal, hip-hop, funk, country, experimental.  Planet Free of Disco & Pop 80’s

Eclectronic Dawn: Remixes, Mashups and Re-works

title: We’ll Do It Live
description: A weekly show focusing on all live music from a broad spectrum of genres.

title: Jam the Controls
description: Freak music, conversation and more

title: imajinary ethnics
description: sonic sprawl of timely rock n' roll for my buds

title: Welcome to Noon
description: Handsome jamz with a weekly theme. Don't talk, put your head on my shoulder.

title: The Radio Birdman Show
description: An homage to the late 60s/early 70s FM underground rock stations.

title: Alleys Of Your Mind
description: Concrète/Mutant/Metallic/Beat/TapeHiss/Acidic/BrainWave/Electroid/Technical/Experimentation

title: Radio 859
description: Frequencies of sound and sight

title: Oort Cloud
description: Celestial and earth sounds, guided meditation and music from and for your root chakra.

title: What Sub Genre
description: A DIY oriented radio show focusing on underground music, both local and international, from the past and present that mocks the question: \"What sub-genre would you call this?\" This show connects different underground scenes that exist separately from each other based on genre, focusing on punk, metal, noise, outsider, and many sub genres in between. New demos of honest, untested bands from around the world are the things that would keep this show going. Each show begins with the local scene report that exposes the bands that are playing frequently around town or just came out with a new demo or album. Root for the underdogs! This show would give me a chance to display these lesser known bands within a cohesive but eclectic playlist of other more established like-minded artists in hopes to tie various DIY scenes in Portland for a more tight knit community.

title: It’s a nice world to visit
description: Punk, Post-Punk, Garage Rock, Psych...A mix of new tracks and old favorites.

title: Virginia Plain / Big Green Jones Show (Alternating)
description:
Virginia Plain: My show will follow a different theme every show and aims to explore different themes, and common ideas within a certain genre or subgenre and also will aim to look deeper into historical context and the effects of society and politics on the art world.

Big Green Jones Show:  80s & 90s Alternative rock with a few tangents. All Vinyl. All Love.

title: The Down-Low
description: An eclectic music show with occasional guest/band interviews

title: If you feel like letting go
description: I would want to mostly play music from my collection and maybe some discussion every so often. Definitely a heavy focus on the music though.

title: Morning Music Mix
description: Get the morning started with a music mix of the latest and greatest, along with older favorites, local Pacific Northwest sounds, and everything in between.

title: Chaos Warp
description: 21st-century auditory medicine show. avant-garde/experimental meanderings. collages of collaborative chaos.

title: The Upstairs Room
description: Themed shows weekly focusing on Post-punk, New Wave, Experimental, and whatever. Book-ended by tracks from The Cure & associates.

title: If I Was Yer Ghoulfriend
description: PopLife meanderings through the Interzone.

title: File Under Various
description:
A vinyl show as eclectic as Portland’s record stores.
Late Monday nights/ early Tuesday mornings (Midnight-2AM), DJ Dan and Olives haul a milk crate full of records from their personal collection over to The Baker Building, and spin anything from their favorite krautrock, to reggae, to ambient electronic, to bossa nova, to the best of Portland’s bargain bins.  Each show has a unique feel, and every record gets filed under various.

title: The Crooked Mile
description: The yelling and the screaming and the distortion and the noise and the death and the doom and the melancholy and the manic and the ennui and the beat and the rhythm and the glitch and the dream.

title: Deep Lez Power Hour
description:
Deep Lez Power Hour provides the soundtrack to the early thirties lesbian odyssey you didn’t know you were on.

Songs will include:
•Tracks from the mix cd you made your ex girlfriend and are finally letting yourself listen to again
•Karaoke jams that strengthen your female friendships
•Dance numbers from that one time you went out to Holocene
•Break up tunes
•Your mom’s old records
•Music you can journal to

Plus: Story time!

title: The Depth of Night
description: A weekly expedition into nocturnal atmospherics, from jazz noir and surf guitars to downtempo grooves and ambient moods.

title: Center for Cassette Studies
description: 60s/70s international. Soul. Postpunk sometimes.

title: Ghostpunkwasteland
description: A stream of consciousness; noise-rock, goth-punk, electronic, metal, indie-pop, industrial-noise, rock, shoe-gaze and aural esoteric delights.

title: Turn The Beat Around w/ DJ Ed
description: Music of all kinds, focusing on post-punk, modern composition, French pop, disco, electro, Afrobeat, and experimental.

title: the Basement
description: Weekly roundup of all the best new rap and hiphop as well as old favorites and classics. Lots of underground and local artists! Often highlighting the best of the west coast and the south.

title: Vibe Detail
djName: Dj Image Research & DJ Life Couch

title: Green Fuzz Rides
description: Emerging from a mutant swamp, the Green Fuzz terrorizes the streets of Portland with its deranged sonic perversions and complimentary out of body transportive experiences. If you are standing on a dark street corner and see a mysterious green glow approaching you, Quick! Stick out your hand! You just might catch a ride with the Green Fuzz.

title: Cinematic Excursions
description: An exploration of film through music, with attention on local music featured in films.

title: Studio Visit
djName: DJ Abi, DJ Megan, and DJ Lawton
description: Studio Visit is a curated sound exhibition of PDX-area artists, art professionals, art lovers, and makers of all kinds. DJs Abi, Megan, and Lawton host on alternating weeks, and each week a new guest joins the show for an exploration of their personal music tastes, creative process, and spontaneous daydreams. The show will be 1/3rd talk and 2/3rds music, and the music is eclectic by definition because weekly guests determine the playlist. The DJs engage guests in discussions about how music affects their artistic practice, which music obsessions they have and why, memories of the local music and art scene, and what makes them tick creatively in general. More of a casual conversation than an interview, Studio Visit desires to uncover hidden sides of the local art scene in an idiosyncratic, random and synesthetic way.

title: In Crates We Dig
description: An exploration of music recorded on vinyl across many eras and genres. Each hour of the show will focus on a particular genre but the variety from hour to hour will be wide and unpredictable.

title: Unrouted
description: Eclectic?

title: Static Atomizer
description: This is a dense and diverse assortment of racket, running the gamut but skewing raucous. 60s innovators, 70s glam and punk, 80s hardcore and post-punk, 90s noise and beyond. An old punker tries to make sense of it all. It’s a punk show.

title: All the Cake Show
description: the most sweet, delicious, and fattening tracks from all genres and all eras. it’s never to early for cake!

title: Black Castle
description:
Mostly black metal, some other stuff


Hence loathed Melancholy,
Of Cerberus, and blackest Midnight born,
In Stygian cave forlorn,
      'Mongst horrid shapes, and shrieks, and sights unholy;
Find out some uncouth cell,
      Where brooding Darkness spreads his jealous wings,
And the night-raven sings;
      There under ebon shades, and low-brow'd rocks,
As ragged as thy locks,
      In dark Cimmerian desert ever dwell.
— excerpt from L'Allegro by John Milton, 1645

title: RipCity Radio
djName: DJ Rusty Virtue / The Vinyl Dictator
description: Music from Portland and surrounding areas - show announcements, local events and benefits.

title: Good Times! End Times!
description:
Feverish Tunes for All // Hip-Shakin' & Soul-Savin' Records from the '50s & '60s

Gospel // Rhythm & Blues // Garage Punk // Rockabilly // Soul // Blues // Doo Wop // Girl Group // Surf // Forever & Ever // Amen

title: Sounds Obscure
description: I want to broadcast a radio show that incorporates all genres of music. Put Hip-Hop along side Country, next to Brazilian Beat and Punk Rock. To color outside the lines, so to speak, and provide an eclectic "mix tape" of weirdness to the air waves. An analog groove to get ya in the right mood!

title: PDX Trans Pride Radio
description:
Broadcasting select music, transgender/LGBTQ news and interviews.

"Trans Lives Matter, and PDX Trans Pride cares"

title: Smokin’ Denim
description: Rock & Roll: Classic rock, Prog and Psych. Vintage inspired and as faded as your ol' blue jeans.

title: Opaque Terrarium
description:
"You think I think I know things;
but YOU know I know differently...
I mean,
(well, you know what I mean, -or DO you?)
It's all in your mind,
-that place where people go,
to say that they are someone thinking something,
about,-something they think they are thinking about someone,
& I'm here to PROVE it to you.
It's all in those or-ga-nyezzzzzzd nnotes you see,
(see?)
JUST...lllike,
MEE-YEWZICK."

title: Crooked Car Tunes
description: am a Pacific Northwest hiphop underground artist, and as an underground artist i wanna provide a service to a vast rise in the music scene in the Portland and Vancouver area, not only here but all over the world. My goal is to host a radio show where artist have the ability no matter what to get there music played on the radio for everyone to hear because that was there original intentions anyways, every artist wants to be heard. Now a days it can be so difficult to get the right opportunity or connections to get that feature on a radio station. Here on my station each show will have a set playlist for the night all full of unknown, up and coming, independent and local artist as well as classics everyone enjoys. Not only that but the show will feature discussion topics interviews with artist, contest and more.

title: Off The Cut
description: Bizarro hip hop and weird beats. Eclectic show that explores the more experimental and soulful end of rap, synthwave, v a p o r w a v e, chiptunes and a variety of other beat-driven and sample-based genres.

title: Unclaimed Baggage
description: Music. All about the music.

title: The Geeks Were Right
description:
The Geeks Were Right // I am DJ D // For Two Hours // Everything Electronic // Fridays, Midnight - 2AM
The Geeks Were Right is devoted to spinning electronic music spanning from the earliest electronic music to now. Hear tracks from the underground, the obscure and experimental; to the latest, most popular tracks being played today. Tune in to hear electronic music from your neighbors down the street to artists from all across the world.
The Geeks Were Right will always cover the ever growing range of electronic music from Glitch, IDM, Coldwave, Electropop, Disco, Krautrock, Folktronica, Spacerock, Dub, Chillwave, House and so much more.



Mixcloud: mixcloud.com/TheGeeksWereRight

Twitter: twitter.com/tgwr_djd


Instagram: instagram.com/thegeekswererightdjd

title: Fencepost Modern
description: Music to tuck your shirt in and jam culture to: a tribute to all the delights of creative music and audio experimentation, some of which sounds like songs — some of which tastes like As Seen On TV artifacts.

title: Universal Sound
description: The goal of this program will be to take the listeners on an adventure across musical styles and time. This wide-ranging mix will hop across genres as diverse as cosmic American, psychedelic, all varieties of jazz, American primitive, soul, and garage. However, hopping to these genres will not be the extent of the journey as the goal of the program will be to use any means necessary (e.g., a pogo stick, time-traveling Delorean, amphibious vehicle, etc.) to scour the musical universe to bring back entertaining and interesting sounds to the audience.

title: Morningstar: The Light In The Darkness
description: "Morningstar: The Light In The Darkness is an exploration of the dark side of music, life, art, and culture, tracing the invisible lines of the paranormal, supernatural, and the occult through mainstream culture. We may be in the darkness, but we're looking for the light."

title: Jah Jams Jukebox
description: Bumping reggae, dub, roots, rocksteady jams for all to enjoy

title: What a Time to Be Alive
description: Excursions into the underground, DIY scenes of Portland, the country, and the world in general.

title: Terminal Beach
description: Terminal Beach explores the multi-faceted and ever-evolving field of electronic music. Primarily techno, house, bass, electro, industrial, beats, experimental/abstract, and ambient styles. We also seek to host a variety of local artists and DJs for live performances, and to shine a light on local and international record labels and music scenes/collectives.

title: Horoscope Club
description: Exploring the various strands of electronic music, whether it's warm analog house, the pounding percussion of techno, the frenzy of footwork and juke, and more.

title: comma summer
description:
80's pop specifically from latinoamerica.
insta: @comma_summer

title: Cheap Rewards
description: Listeners can expect to hear traditional bluegrass and old-time music, 70s punk rock, and a hefty dose of old-school soul. We'll be exploring the common space between Bill Monroe, Curtis Mayfield, and The Ramones.

title: The After Party Slumber Party
description: Talk + Electronic music (probably some other genres... I'm super eclectic)

title: Weekend Family Music Hour
description:
Weekend Family Music Hour is children led by DJs Opal & Ayler who are 7 & 9 yrs old. They are supervised by Mom (Karen) & we play eclectic music which ranges from ethnic, Miami bass, soul, funk, rock, psych, hip hop, reggae, jazz & folk. Birthday shout outs with Miami Bass song by Luke Skywalker, "It's Your Birthday." Child led discussions on politics, magic and childhood subjects.

We bring our Moog in for ambience on holidays or special occasions.

title: …Hold Onto the Rails!
description: Tune in Sundays from 6:00 to 8:00 a.m. for new wave, glam, protopunk and postpunk done the RCH way. Depth, not breadth. New-to-you or a just a new view on an old favorite. The streets are slick... hold onto the rails! On twitter: @rgbbyrch

title: Shaggy Planet
description:
Music from planet earth, past, present and future.

Always searching for the perfect groove, tune in and lets find it together.

title: Live from Beech St Parlor / Zaph Mann’s IMOJP Show (Alternating)
description:
Each week you get either a live broadcast from Beech Street Parlor, or from The Soup Caves... deep inside Another Planet.
Zaph Mann's IMOJP (In Memory Of John Peel) Show, adheres to the style and values of the late great DJ John Peel: Breaking edgy new music from outside the mainstream in a mesmerising mix of genres. Often #1 in the worldwide freeform charts, selected the best show *anywhere* to here new music by the UK's Louder Than War - you won't like it all, but you'll hear something special, ahead of the crowd.

title: Turtles Have Short Legs
description: An intoxicating mix of psychedelic and experimental sounds, past and present. Expect krautrock/kosmische nuggets, modal acid folk & weirdlore, hauntological delights, pop-sike pipe-dreams, radiophonics & analog electronics, surreal sound collages & drones, progressive/avant-rock oddities, and unusual international sounds.

title: Yr Mom
description: Yr Mom is a schiztastic show that goes from "A" to 3.14, then right over to Q. No rules, just rawk in its various forms. Listen to Yr Mom. She knows best.

title: Esoteria
description:
Join Odd Monster on an eccentric exploration through music miscellany.  Expect deep pulls from all across the board: No genre is safe, no artist too famous nor obscure.

Questions, comments and threats can be directed toward the Esoteria Facebook page.

title: Mid-Day Meltdown
description:
Welcome to the Mid-day Meltdown, with your host Mister Pants!
West Coast garage rock melodies, Pacific North West dream pop sounds and Bossa Nova beats.  Creep with me through the mind fuzz, and hopefully catch a tingle or two along the way.  We weave the web from Afro-beat to Little Feat, with new sounds every week!
So come on down the dial, and stay awhile.
— Yours truly, Mister Pants

title: Throwback Thursdays
description:
r&b, funk, dance and hip-hop from the 80s

 music for grown folks / from when they was kids

title: The Silver Gold
description: Sunday night nostalgia and film reverence. This show explores music history, and often its relationship to cinema. Past themes included "Wim Wenders," "Motown Mother's Day," and "Florida." The Silver Gold was previously called Sweet Tarnation.

title: Zigzag Body Talk
description:
An eclectic mix of new and old music.
Lots of local music, surf, soul, psych, hip-hop, modern funk, punk, new wave, no wave and everything in between.
